definitions.text: (film) a gradual transition from one scene to the next; the next scene is gradually superimposed as the former scene fades out
cause to go into a solution
examples: The recipe says that we should dissolve a cup of sugar in two cups of water

definitions.text: stop functioning or cohering as a unit
examples: The political wing of the party dissolved after much internal fighting
The news dissolved her into tears
She dissolved into tears when she heard that she had lost all her savings in the pyramid scheme
dissolve a shot or a picture
The sugar quickly dissolved in the coffee

definitions.text: become or cause to become soft or liquid
examples: The giant iceberg dissolved over the years during the global warming phase

definitions.text: bring the association of to an end or cause to break up
examples: The decree officially dissolved the marriage
the judge dissolved the tobacco company
The President dissolved the parliament and called for new elections
